Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

dstsInstance.description: The dSTS instance where the Application resides. Required.

applicationAccountName.description: The name of the Application. Required.

realms.description: The realms of the application. Optional.

servicePrincipalNames.description: The Service Principal Names of the application. Optional.

replyToAddresses.description: The Reply Addresses of application. Optional.

groupId.description: GUID of the dSCM Application group to which the Application belongs. Optional.

groupName.description: Group name of the dSCM Application group to which the Application belongs. Optional.

isMfaEnabled.description: If set to true, authenticating to the application requires MFA. Optional.

sawDeviceEnforcement.description: If it is null, full SAW enforcement will apply to the application. Possible options are NoEnforcement, SAWFull, SAWElevatedOnly. Optional.

isElevatedAccess.description: If your application (service) is exclusively limited to System Metadata, Read-Only access levels, set it to false. Optional.

isProduction.description: If your application (service) is exclusively NonProduction, set it to false. Optional.

claimRules.description: The claim rule which apply to this Application. Optional.

applicationClientIdentity.description: Client identity when using the application as a client. Optional.

ApplicationClaimRule.description: The claim rule which apply to Application.

clientIdentifier.description: A claim used to identify client. e.g., group claim, application name claim, object id claim.

clientIdentityOrigin.description: The name of the original identity provider of the client. e.g., federation for user or dsts instance for applications.

isRegionalEnforced.description: If true, when the claim is scoped to service account group, only SCIs on the same dsts instance where the service accounts exist can get the claim.

type.description: The type of your client identity.e.g., Dmsi, Certificate, SubjectName.

clientTokenIpRangeRestrictions.description: Provide a list IP address ranges to restrict where this application's client token can be requested. Optional.

applicationGroupName.description: Name of the Application Group. Required.

applicationName.description: Common Name for all Applications inside the group. Optional.

servicePrincipalNames.description: The Service Principal Names of the application. Optional.

replyToAddresses.description: The Reply Addresses of application. Optional.

isMfaEnabled.description: If set to true, authenticating to the application requires MFA. Optional.

isGlobalService.description: If not set, default is regional service. Optional.

sawDeviceEnforcement.description: If it is null, full SAW enforcement will apply to the application. Possible options are NoEnforcement, SAWFull, SAWElevatedOnly. Optional.

clientTokenIpRangeRestrictions.description: Change.Remove client token ip range. Optional.

cloudId.description: The cloud identifier for the application group. Possible options are PROD, blackforest, fairfax, mooncake, ex, rx. Required.

regions.description: Specific dSTS instances to create applications on. Optional.

claimRules.description: The claim rules that apply to this Application Group. Optional.

applicationClientIdentity.description: Client identity when using the application as a client. Optional.

value.description: Authentication requirement value. E.g. SAWEnforcement or PTH. Required.

requiredIpRanges.description: List of required IP ranges. Optional.

Azure.Core.azureLocation.description: Represents an Azure geography region where supported resource providers live.

Claim.description: A claim used to identify client. e.g., group claim, application name claim, object id claim.

ClaimExpansion.description: Claim expansion for the service client identity group.

serviceAccountGroupServiceTreeId.description: Service account group service tree id. Optional.

isRegionalEnforced.description: Flag to indicate if the claim is regional enforced or not. Optional.

ClaimProvisioningsForGroup.description: The claim provisionings for a service client identity group.

isUnscoped.description: Flag to indicate if the claim is unscoped. If the claim needs to work for all service accounts set the IsUnscoped to true, but the claim's type and value will need to be previously added a as global claim to dSCM. Optional.

scopedToServiceAccountGroupId.description: Scoped to service account group id. If IsUnscoped is false, set the ScopedToServiceAccountGroupId to the ID of group the claim will apply to. If IsUnscoped is true, you can omit the ScopedToServiceAccountGroupId. Optional.

scopedToServiceAccountGroup.description: Scoped to service account group name. Optional.

scopedToServiceAccountGroupServiceTreeId.description: Scoped to service account group service tree id. Optional.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

DsmsAllowlistResourceListResult.description: The response of a DsmsAllowlistResource list operation.

value.description: The DsmsAllowlistResource items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

folderName.description: The name of the folder to apply allowlist changes to. This should be the full folder path starting with a '$', with '$' replacing all '/' characters. Example: '/my-folder/root-folder' should be passed as '$my-folder$root-folder

targetDsmsEndpoints.description: The dSMS endpoints to apply allowlist changes to. The folder specified in FolderName will be updated on each of the TargetDsmsEndpoints. If this is left null, this will default to all the dSMS endpoints used for the root folder.

dnsPatterns.description: Dns domain patterns in the allowlist. Patterns with '*' are accepted values here.

deploymentSubscriptions.description: Guids of Azure deployment subscriptions in allowlist.

storageSubscriptions.description: Guids of Azure storage subscriptions in allowlist.

requestId.description: Request ID; a part of provisioning ResultData output.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

DsmsRootFolderResourceListResult.description: The response of a DsmsRootFolderResource list operation.

value.description: The DsmsRootFolderResource items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

folderName.description: The name of the root folder to add. This should be the full folder path starting with a "$", with "$" replacing all "/" characters

cloudId.description: The cloud ID where the root folder should be added. Acceptable values: Public, Fairfax, Mooncake, USSec, USNat

requestId.description: Request ID; a part of provisioning ResultData output.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

DstsApplicationResourceListResult.description: The response of a DstsApplicationResource list operation.

value.description: The DstsApplicationResource items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

deploymentMode.description: The mode used to deploy the resource. Default value is Incremental. Acceptable values: Incremental, Complete.

requestId.description: Request ID; a part of provisioning ResultData output.

applicationGroupId.description: Application Group ID; a part of provisioning ResultData output.

DstsClaimMapping.description: Claim mapping for authorization of the account.

inputType.description: Type of input identity. This is case-insensitive. E.g. "http://sts.msft.net/user/Group".

inputValue.description: Name or ID of input identity. E.g. "%($CS.CplatViewerGroup)".

outputType.description: Type of output identity, which is mapped from input identity. This is case-insensitive. E.g. "http://schemas.microsoft.com/ws/2008/06/identity/claims/role".

outputValue.description: Name or ID of output identity, which is mapped from input identity. E.g. "PlatformServiceViewer" or "PlatformServiceOperator".

federation.description: Federation context for the mapping. E.g. "MSIT-ADFS-Federation" or "BF-ADFS-Federation".

DstsClaimProvisioning.description: This model represents a claim provisioning in SCI.

claimType.description: Gets or sets the type of identity in the target service. This is case-insensitive. E.g. "http://schemas.microsoft.com/ws/2008/06/identity/claims/role".

claimValue.description: Gets or sets the name or ID in the target service. This is case-insensitive. E.g. "PlatformServiceViewer" or "PlatformServiceOperator".

scopedToServiceAccount.description: Gets or sets the service account name of the target service. This is case-insensitive. E.g. "target-service-%(ArmRegionName).acs.%($CS.ComputeDnsSuffix)".

scopedServiceAccountGroupId.description: Gets or sets the service account group id of the target service name.

scopedServiceAccountGroupName.description: Gets or sets the service account group name of the target service name.

scopedServiceTreeId.description: Gets or sets the service tree id of the scoped service account.

dstsInstance.description: Dstsinstance for the claim. This is case-insensitive. E.g. "co2agg04-dsts.dsts.core.azure-test.net" for dogfood.

name.description: Realm's name. This is case-insensitive. E.g. "svc://crpadmin@%(ArmRegionName).acs.%($CS.ComputeDnsSuffix)/".

redirectionUrl.description: Realm's redirection URL. This is case-insensitive. E.g. "https://%(ArmRegionName).acs.%($CS.ComputeDnsSuffix)/".

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

DstsServiceAccountResourceListResult.description: The response of a DstsServiceAccountResource list operation.

value.description: The DstsServiceAccountResource items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

id.description: Unique ID of the service account. Its value can be a GUID for a new account, or for an existing account created by CIS resource template or by other method. Or its value can be null or empty string for a new account, or for an existing account created by CIS resource template (but not by other method). In the latter case, CIS generates a GUID to be the new account's ID, and remembers the ID for future provisioning of the same service account. This is case-insensitive.

accountName.description: Service Account name, which must be unique for a given dsts endpoint. This is case-insensitive. E.g. "%(ArmRegionName).acs.%($CS.ComputeDnsSuffix)".

dstsInstance.description: DSTS instance in which the account is created. This is case-insensitive. E.g. "co2agg04-dsts.dsts.core.azure-test.net" for dogfood.

groupId.description: GroupId of the account. This is case-insensitive. This is optional, and the account is placed into default group when this is not specified. This can be the GroupId of an existing group, which can be found at dSCM web portal.

groupName.description: GroupName of the account. This is case-insensitive. This is optional, and the account is placed into default group when this is not specified. This can be the GroupName of an existing group, which can be found at dSCM web portal.

accountTags.description: Tags to add to the account.

requestId.description: Request ID; a part of provisioning ResultData output.

serviceAccountId.description: Service Account ID; a part of provisioning ResultData output.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

DstsServiceClientIdentityGroupManagedRes.description: The response of a DstsServiceClientIdentityGroupManagedResource list operation.

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

DstsServiceClientIdentityGroupManagedRes.description: DSTS service client identity (SCI) group, which is managed by DSTS.

groupName.description: The service client identity group name. The name cannot collide with the name of another service client identity group or another service account group at the same dSTS instance. Please follow dSTS guideline for naming convention. Required.

commonServiceClientIdentityName.description: Common service client identity name. If set, all Service Client Identities (SCIs) belonging to this group will have the same name (as set by this field). Optional.

listOfClaimProvisioningsForGroup.description: List of claim provisionings for the service client identity group. This describes how the client identity is authorized. ClaimProvisionings included in an SCI group can specify scope to a service account group. With this, your claim can be manually or automatically (depending on autoapproval permissions) approved by the owning team of the service account for the first time, and later new SCI instance in the same SCI group will have the claim added by default. Optional.

commonCertificates.description: List of common certificates for the service client identity group. Optional.

commonAuthenticationRequirements.description: List of common authentication requirements for the service client identity group. Optional.

cloudId.description: Cloud identifier for the service client identity group. Optional.

accountVersion.description: Account version for the service client identity group. Optional.

claimExpansions.description: List of claim expansions for the service client identity group. Optional.

dstsInstances.description: List of dSTS instances for the service client identity group. A list contains specific dSTS instances to create identities on. Optional.

enforceServiceClientIdentityIds.description: List of member SCI ids to enforce group properties on. Each ServiceClientIdentityId element should contain a valid guid. Optional.

requestId.description: Request ID; a part of provisioning ResultData output.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

DstsServiceClientIdentityGroupSubjectNam.description: The response of a DstsServiceClientIdentityGroupSubjectNameBasedResource list operation.

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

DstsServiceClientIdentityGroupSubjectNam.description: DSTS service client identity (SCI) group, which is subjectName based.

commonSubjectNames.description: List of common subject names for the service client identity group. Client identification is based on the combination of the Subject Name and Issuer of the certificate. For groups, the CommonSubjectNames can be explicitly specified. When creating a SubjectName-Based SCI Group and subsequently creating SCIs, the subject names associated with the group automatically appear in the SCI. Optional.

groupName.description: The service client identity group name. The name cannot collide with the name of another service client identity group or another service account group at the same dSTS instance. Please follow dSTS guideline for naming convention. Required.

commonServiceClientIdentityName.description: Common service client identity name. If set, all Service Client Identities (SCIs) belonging to this group will have the same name (as set by this field). Optional.

listOfClaimProvisioningsForGroup.description: List of claim provisionings for the service client identity group. This describes how the client identity is authorized. ClaimProvisionings included in an SCI group can specify scope to a service account group. With this, your claim can be manually or automatically (depending on autoapproval permissions) approved by the owning team of the service account for the first time, and later new SCI instance in the same SCI group will have the claim added by default. Optional.

commonCertificates.description: List of common certificates for the service client identity group. Optional.

commonAuthenticationRequirements.description: List of common authentication requirements for the service client identity group. Optional.

cloudId.description: Cloud identifier for the service client identity group. Optional.

accountVersion.description: Account version for the service client identity group. Optional.

claimExpansions.description: List of claim expansions for the service client identity group. Optional.

dstsInstances.description: List of dSTS instances for the service client identity group. A list contains specific dSTS instances to create identities on. Optional.

enforceServiceClientIdentityIds.description: List of member SCI ids to enforce group properties on. Each ServiceClientIdentityId element should contain a valid guid. Optional.

requestId.description: Request ID; a part of provisioning ResultData output.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

DstsServiceClientIdentityResourceListRes.description: The response of a DstsServiceClientIdentityResource list operation.

value.description: The DstsServiceClientIdentityResource items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

accountName.description: Gets or sets the account name. This is case-insensitive. E.g. "%(ArmRegionName).acs.%($CS.ComputeDnsSuffix)".

dstsInstance.description: Gets or sets the DSTS instance endpoint FQDN, in which the account is created. This is case-insensitive. E.g. "co2agg04-dsts.dsts.core.azure-test.net" for dogfood.

claimProvisionings.description: Gets or sets a list of claim provisionings.

requiredIpRanges.description: Gets or sets a list of required IP ranges. Optional.

groupId.description: Gets or sets the GroupId of the account. This is case-insensitive. This is optional, and the account is placed into default group when this is not specified. This can be the GroupId of an existing group, which can be found at dSCM web portal. E.g. "76c46cf8-a5b4-40e6-a561-b0eb1c303cd9".

groupName.description: Gets or sets the GroupName of the account. This is case-insensitive. This is optional, and the service client identity is placed into default group when this is not specified. This can be the GroupName of an existing group, which can be found at dSCM web portal.

azureLocation.description: The Azure location / region for the SCI. E.g. "francec" for France Central.

subscriptions.description: Gets or sets the subscriptions for the SCI. This is optional. E.g. "5d711910-92ea-4ff9-b70d-1e61307faaac,a524674c-7024-40f1-afe9-127ab5a2e1b0".

requestId.description: Request ID; a part of provisioning ResultData output.

serviceClientIdentity.description: Service Client Identity ID; a part of provisioning ResultData output.

IpRange.description: Class for a contiguous range of IP Addresses.

RequiredIpRange.description: This model represents an IP range in SCI.

fromIpAddress.description: Gets or sets the start of IP range. E.g. "172.1.1.1".

toIpAddress.description: Gets or sets the end of IP range. E.g. "172.1.1.5".

SubjectNameBasedIdentity.description: Represents application subject name base identity.

subjectNames.description: List of subject names for sni based auth
